alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 12:55PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM HST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE ISLAND OF MAUI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Maui in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 400 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1247 PM HST, radar indicated nearly stationary heavy showers over west Maui, with rain falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. Normally dry gulches that run through Kihei and Makena will likely have flowing water this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kihei, Wailea, Ulupalakua, Makena and Keokea. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 400 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
